title: Booking contract for IBJJF 2025 Crown

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Booking contract for IBJJF 2025 Crown
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Booking contracts and reconciliation documents for the International Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Federation 2025 Crown, held at the Walter Pyramid on Nov. 23, 2025. Please include final ticket sales and event costs, if available.

The event is referenced on Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/p/DRLUqyWDdDz/) and on the IBJJF website (https://crownibjjf.com/).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Amico

communications.subject: 25-101:  RE: California Public Records Act Request: Booking contract for IBJJF 2025 Crown
communications.communication:
Dear Chris Amico,

We received your November 19, 2025, Public Records Act request for the following records: Booking contracts and reconciliation documents for the International Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Federation 2025 Crown, held at the Walter Pyramid on Nov. 23, 2025. Including final ticket sales and event costs, if available.
CSU has conducted a reasonable search for these records under California Government Code §7922.535 and has determined that your request, either in whole or in part, seeks copies of disclosable public records.  CSU will make available to you any that are public.

Records subject to the following exemptions will be withheld or redacted as appropriate:  Deliberative Process. Records that reflect the deliberative, decision-making process of the CSU, which often involves multiple individuals, who need to converse about issues candidly. Cal. Govt. Code §7922.000; Times Mirror Co. v. Superior Court (1991) 53 Cal.3d 1325; Montrose Chemical Corporation of California v. Train (D.DC 1982) 491 F.2d 63; Rogers v. Superior Court (1993) 19 Cal. App.4th 469.

We will let you know when we have gathered all the records.  It will be necessary to redact from them any personal and otherwise privileged information before they can be made available to you.  CSU estimates the records will be available January 24, 2026.

If you wish to inspect the records at CSULB, you may contact me to schedule a mutually convenient date and time.  If you wish to receive copies instead, CSU may charge the direct cost of duplication (20 cents per page).  Once the records are located, we will advise you as to the exact number of pages upon which any charge will be based.  We will require full payment before we begin the redaction and duplication process. The decision that records are exempt and will not be disclosed was made by the Records Access Officer at CSULB, Jamarr Johnson.
Regards,

Jamarr Johnson, CCSA
Director of Audit, Public Records & Special Projects
California State University, Long Beach
1250 Bellflower Blvd, BH 320
Long Beach, CA 90840
(562) 985-6033
[csuLB-long]

title: FlockSafety Emails 12-2025 (Lincolnwood Police Department)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FlockSafety Emails 12-2025 (Lincolnwood Police Department)
communications.communication:
To the FOIA Officer of Lincolnwood Police Department,

This request is made under the provisions of Illinois Freedom of Information Act. for the following records:

Copies of all emails received by your agency from any sender email address containing the domain @flocksafety.com between 12/1/2025 and the date this request is processed (inclusive of those dates).

This request includes but is not limited to:

1. Emails received by any employee official or representative of Lincolnwood Police Department using an agency issued email account
2. All attachments included with those emails
3. Related metadata sufficient to identify sender recipient (To:, CC:, BCC:), date and time of receipt, and subject line

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the case of any applicable fees, it is requested that an estimate of the total charges be provided prior to fulfilling this request. The preferred method of receipt is through electronic delivery.

Your assistance and cooperation in this matter are greatly appreciated. A response within 5 business days, as the statute requires, is anticipated.

With thanks,

David S. (he/him/his), Lucy Parsons Labs

title: Child care data request

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Child care data request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Information related to all child care providers in Illinois since 2020. Specifically, the following information at the child care provider-month level, as it is available, from January 2020 to present:

1) Provider name and/or license ID
2) Address
3) Licensed capacity each month
4) Number of children receiving Child Care Assistance Program (CCAP) each month

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin

communications.subject: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Child care data request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Illinois Freedom of Information Act. request, copied below, and originally submitted on Jan. 21, 2026. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: 26-FTS-8562 Pepin - Extension
communications.communication:
Dear Gabrielle Pepin
The Illinois Department of Human Services (IDHS) received your request for records pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) on January 22, 2026.  Your request seeks the following:


                Information related to all child care providers in Illinois since 2020. Specifically, the following information at the child care provider-month level, as it is available, from January 2020 to present:

1) Provider name and/or license ID
2) Address
3) Licensed capacity each month
4) Number of children receiving Child Care Assistance Program (CCAP) each month

Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to five business days. 5 ILCS 140/3(e).  As such, the Department is extending the time to respond to your request by five business days on one or more of the following bases:


  *   The requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records;
  *   The request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records;
  *   The requested records have not been located in the course of a routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them;
  *   The requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; and
  *   The request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by FOIA without unduly burdening or interfering with the operation of the public body.

The Department will respond to your request on or before February 5, 2026.  Thank you for your patience and interest in the Illinois Department of Human Services.

Sincerely,

Sean Reddington (he/him/his)
Associate General Counsel | Office of the General Counsel
Illinois Department of Human Services
Email: DHS.FOIAOfficer@illinois.gov<mailto:DHS.FOIAOfficer@illinois.gov>

[IDHS Illinois Department of Human Services]



State of Illinois - CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE: The information contained in this communication is confidential, may be attorney-client privileged or attorney work product, may constitute inside information or internal deliberative staff communication, and is intended only for the use of the addressee. Unauthorized use, disclosure or copying of this communication or any part thereof is strictly prohibited and may be unlawful. If you have received this communication in error, please notify the sender immediately by return e-mail and destroy this communication and all copies thereof, including all attachments. The Illinois Department of Human Services is still processing your request. Accordingly, the Department is requesting an additional five business day extension, which is permissible under Section 3(e) of FOIA.  5 ILCS 140/3(e).

Under the new deadline, the Department will respond on or before February 12, 2026 .  If you do not agree to this extension, please contact me at your earliest convenience.

Sincerely,

Sean Reddington (he/him/his)
Associate General Counsel | Office of the General Counsel

files.source: Department of Human Services, Illinois

communications.subject: 26-FTS-8562 Pepin - Response
communications.communication:
Dear Gabrielle Pepin:

The Illinois Department of Human Services (IDHS) received your request for records pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) on January 21, 2026.  Your request seeks the following:

                Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Information related to all child care providers in Illinois since 2020. Specifically, the following information at the child care provider-month level, as it is available, from January 2020 to present:

1) Provider name and/or license ID
2) Address
3) Licensed capacity each month
4) Number of children receiving Child Care Assistance Program (CCAP) each month

Attached please find records responsive to your request.
Please note, the Department is prohibited from releasing information that would tend to identify an individual as a recipient of Child Care Assistance Program services under the Illinois Public Aid Code. 305 ILCS 5/11-9.  As a result, the Department did not include in-home childcare providers on the attached spreadsheet listing the Name/Address/Capacity information pursuant to Section 7(1)(a) of FOIA, which provides an exemption for information that is prohibited from release under State or federal law. 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a).

Please note that the spreadsheet listing the number of children receiving CCAP each month includes counts from all provider types, including in-home providers.

To the extent you consider this response to be an improper denial of your FOIA request, you have a right to seek review by writing to the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the following address:

Public Access Counselor
Office of the Attorney General
500 South 2nd Street
Springfield, Illinois 62706
Fax: 217-782-1396
E-Mail: Public.Access@ilag.gov<mailto:Public.Access@ilag.gov>

If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this response when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. You also have the right to seek judicial review of this response. 5 ILCS 140/11.

Thank you for your interest in the Illinois Department of Human Services.

Sincerely,

Sean Reddington (he/him/his)
Associate General Counsel | Office of the General Counsel
Illinois Department of Human Services
Email: DHS.FOIAOfficer@illinois.gov<mailto:DHS.FOIAOfficer@illinois.gov>

[IDHS Illinois Department of Human Services]

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: CO County CVR Request (2022, 2024) (Garfield County Clerk and Recorder's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast each election generated by the voting system.

In case it is helpful for your reference, you can find an example of these records in REDACTED format at this link on the Arapahoe County webpage: https://www.arapahoevotes.gov/transparency
If you follow the "Redacted Cast Vote Record (CVR)" link on that webpage, it will download a csv file with Arapahoe County's redacted CVR records (this: https://gis.arapahoegov.com/dl_data/cr_voter_data/redacted_cvr/REDACTED_CVR_Export_20241126111830_330948.zip.)

I am requesting these records NOT redacted pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

To whom it may concern,
Your request cannot be completed as filed. Please use the CORA request form located on our website.

https://www.garfieldcountyco.gov/attorney/open-records-policy/

Thank you,
Garfield County Elections

title: Alexandria VA

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Alexandria VA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request the contract that the district entered into with a vendor for the stop arm camera pilot (50 buses). 

Additionally any applicable intergovernmental agreements with the City of Alexandria and/or the police department for the enforcement of school bus stop arm camera violations. 

Lastly, any records related to the procurement of the vendor stop-arm camera contract.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Jon Smith.

title: Public Records Request - Monroe County 4

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - Monroe County 4
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to video footage from a police intervention, specifically from the body camera worn by the officer(s) and the dashcam of the police vehicles involved. Article:

https://wsvn.com/news/local/florida/new-york-man-arrested-for-dui-and-drug-possession-after-dancing-naked-on-us-1-in-florida-keys-deputies-say/

Exact date of incident: March 5, 2025

Names of parties involved: Timothy Mahoney


I intend to use this footage solely for educational purposes to promote a better understanding of law enforcement procedures and the application of the law.


I understand that there may be associated costs for providing this footage, and I am more than willing to cover any fees incurred. Please inform me about the necessary procedures and the costs involved.


Thank you in advance for your assistance. I trust that this footage will be invaluable for my educational efforts, and I greatly appreciate your cooperation.

Best regards,
George Smith

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

George Smith

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request #PRR-6018-2025
communications.communication:
Dear Records Department,

Thank you for providing the video files related to my request.

However, after reviewing the materials received, I noticed that the most important footage appears to be missing. Specifically, the **first responding officer’s body-worn camera video** and the corresponding in-car/dash camera recording were not included.

The footage provided does not include the responding officer’s primary bodycam recording of the initial contact and arrest, which is essential to the request and appears to be listed in the invoice/records description.

Could you please review this matter and provide the missing files, or advise whether they were withheld, unavailable, or omitted in error?

Thank you for your assistance, and I appreciate your help in resolving this issue.

Best regards,
George Smith

[1]: https://wsvn.com/news/local/florida/new-york-man-arrested-for-dui-and-drug-possession-after-dancing-naked-on-us-1-in-florida-keys-deputies-say/ "New York Man arrested for DUI and drug possession after dancing naked on US 1 in Florida Keys, deputies say - WSVN 7News | Miami News, Weather, Sports | Fort Lauderdale"

title: Banned books list (Department of Corrections)

communications.subject: Montana Freedom of Information Act Request: Banned books list (Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Montana Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all books and other printed publications that are banned or otherwise not permitted in prisons. Please include the title and author of the publication. If available, please include the reasons for prohibiting the publication, as well as the date of the decision.

If possible, please send this information in a searchable spreadsheet format, such as an Excel file or a CSV file.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

title: request for data on sex offender civil commitment

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: request for data on sex offender civil commitment
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting the number of sex offenders ("sexually violent predators") who are in civil detention or civil commitment under the Sexually Violent Predator Act (SVPA) in New Jersey. Specifically, I request the following data as of the most recent date available:
1) the total number of people civilly committed in New Jersey by sex for sex offenses; and,
2) the number of people civilly detained in New Jersey by sex for sex offenses.
If this data is not available by sex, I request the total numbers regardless of sex. If this data is held by another state agency, I request the name of that agency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emily Widra

communications.subject: OPRA Request #24213
communications.communication:
Ms. Widra,

Please see the attached correspondence regarding your recent OPRA request.

Thank you,

John Falvey
NJDOC Records Custodian

communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C241086-092625 received on September 26, 2025 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV25-C241086-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C241086-092625. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV25-C241086-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net)

title: PSC Enforcement Actions

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: PSC Enforcement Actions
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Enforcement actions, penalties, fines, or corrective orders issued against Central Hudson Gas & Electric Corp. (2019-present), including the nature of the violation, dollar amounts, and resolution status.

Settlement agreements or consent orders between the PSC/DPS and Central Hudson (2019-present).

Records of customer refunds, credits, or remediation payments Central Hudson has been required or agreed to provide as a result of PSC action, complaint resolution, or billing error corrections—including aggregate totals and the nature of the underlying issue.

Audio/video recordings of any PSC hearings, proceedings, or public meetings related to the above enforcement matters.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

EJ Fox

title: Kentucky HHS response

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Kentucky HHS response
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Communications and correspondence with the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services regarding the Aug. 26, 2025, HHS letter requesting the Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services remove content from the state's Personal Responsibility Education Program curricula and program materials. For reference, the letter can be found here: https://acf.gov/sites/default/files/documents/main/08.26.25-Combined-PREP-Letters.pdf.

I also request internal communications between any Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services employees about the aforementioned letter. If the content changes were made, I request a copy of the material before it was changed as well as a copy of the material after it was changed.

I additionally request that, if possible, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.subject: Office of the Inspector General Division of Health Care :: H000010-011426
communications.communication:
Dear Ileana Garnand: 
Thank you for your interest in open records of Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services. Your Office of the Inspector General Division of Health Care request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the Kentucky Open Records Act—KRS 61.870 to KRS 61.884. Your request was received in this office on 1/14/2026 and given the reference number H000010-011426 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Communications and correspondence with the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services regarding the Aug. 26, 2025, HHS letter requesting the Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services remove content from the state's Personal Responsibility Education Program curricula and program materials. For reference, the letter can be found here: https://acf.gov/sites/default/files/documents/main/08.26.25-Combined-PREP-Letters.pdf. 

I also request internal communications between any Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services employees about the aforementioned letter. If the content changes were made, I request a copy of the material before it was changed as well as a copy of the material after it was changed. 

I additionally request that, if possible, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Ileana Garnand 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the records you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records requested. Pursuant to KRS 61.880(1), the Cabinet has five (5) business days from receipt of your request to respond. 
 
PLEASE NOTE: The Kentucky Open Records Act does not require public agencies to create new records, to provide or compile information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when the Cabinet responds to your request. Again, thank you for using the Open Records Center. 
Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services 
 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Open Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXT-2BnpR4ed5y5dM62QTWI-2Fwbtbnwp1BB8X0i5Km3oDLPIawyZl9THiAOkllK5gn5SfQ-3D-3DPeGZ_lZFtByWRbdYvxdCz9CWuxN-2F31TxGE8e6chiAz-2FWFXJhvIv1ZsWbkMe1Sz7am0gt7770-2FG-2F1M03wGe3cckFL6LIIJ8ucYElqYhquEY-2FyGIC2tLl69gy3UbfnBnDWQph0r1MtAd67YqfL1rdFQu9ml-2FAZ2z-2Bh8g2fBVCRuDSOK4CnU8NzgK-2BAVv-2Ba6utDdo6TSnQTLcRrDyye9qF3lXRJBCyAlAFtBoR99072ImZ78D4D4ifT-2FSP-2Fd9tWff-2BzoHIJF7HMu7wBWoKZrcs7falW1lYvhkc3fbSKHvBRQrslXu8Y0mXM9S0FvuYg3JDoDvPbtm8RJVQoCXBe6NOR8MaRsviX748ck5jfYuclEC1Fm23Ga-2B1pgQlSr7wSaYazqvksD)

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: Office of the Inspector General Division of Health Care of January 14, 2026, Reference # H000010-011426 Dear Ileana Garnand, The Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services received an open records request from you on January 14, 2026. Your request mentioned: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Communications and correspondence with the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services regarding the Aug. 26, 2025, HHS letter requesting the Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services remove content from the state's Personal Responsibility Education Program curricula and program materials. For reference, the letter can be found here: https://acf.gov/sites/default/files/documents/main/08.26.25-Combined-PREP-Letters.pdf. 

I also request internal communications between any Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services employees about the aforementioned letter. If the content changes were made, I request a copy of the material before it was changed as well as a copy of the material after it was changed. 

I additionally request that, if possible, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Ileana Garnand Pursuant to KRS 61.872(5), the records you have requested are not readily available because the Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services is having to manually search its files and records database for responsive records. The Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services is searching for responsive records and will review any responsive records for compliance with the Kentucky Open Records Act. The Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services will need until February 5, 2026, to respond to your request. For questions or additional information, please reply to this email. Sincerely, Natalie Nelson 
Office of Legal Services (OLS) Information Regarding Your Right to Appeal 
If you wish to appeal this decision, you may do so by filing a complaint with the Office of the Attorney General, Open Records/Open Meetings, The Capitol, 700 Capitol Avenue, Suite 118, Frankfort, KY 40601, pursuant to KRS 61.880(2), or by filing an original action in Franklin Circuit Court under KRS 61.882. If you first appeal to the Attorney General but are dissatisfied with the Attorney General’s decision, you may further appeal to Circuit Court pursuant to KRS 61.880(5).

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Eaton County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Eaton County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Eaton County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
Attached please find an invoice totaling $26.52 in response to your FOIA request. There are only two methods of payment available. You can mail a check or money order made payable to Eaton County and include the FOIA # 172-5529 to my attention at the address below. If you elect to pay in person, you can come to the Controller’s Office in the courthouse Monday through Thursday at the address below to pay for your FOIA request. Our office hours are 8:30am – 12:00pm and 1:00pm – 4:30 pm Monday – Thursday, closed to the public on Friday.

The County has thirty (30) business days, not to include weekends or holidays, to produce the records upon receipt of payment.  The County does not accept credit cards, on-line payments, or payments over the phone. No records will be released until after full payment has been received. The records will be emailed to the email address used to submit the request.

Note: If a check is returned for non-payment, an NSF fee of $50.00 will be charged each time that same item is presented for payment when an account lacks sufficient available funds, and it is returned unpaid as a result. Additionally,  future checks will not be accepted for payment, only cash or money order.

Thank you.

Grace Ramirez, FOIA Specialist
Controller’s Office
Eaton County Courthouse
1045 Independence Blvd.
Charlotte, MI 48813
Phone: 517.543.2287
Fax: 517.543.3331
[A close up of a logo  Description automatically generated]

title: IQA Records Request

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: IQA Records Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All data on which ICE based the following language included in today's detainee death notification for Shiraz Fatehali Sachwani (https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/criminal-illegal-alien-pakistan-passes-away-suspected-natural-causes-fort-worth): 
"ICE’s in-custody deaths this past year average less than 1%--this is the lowest in ICE history."
2. Any communications between ICE and DHS Press officers substantiating these two objective factual statements. 

I hereby request expedited processing pursuant to 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e) and make the following statements in support of this request under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746: 
1. I am a member of the media primarily engaged in information dissemination. See www.muckrack.com/Andrew-Free
2. ICE's statement that the average of in-custody deaths the past year "is the lowest in ICE history" contains no identifiable, objective statistical basis in fact. 
3. There is an urgent need to inform the public if ICE is misleading policymakers and the world in press releases about deaths in ICE custody. 
4. ICE is under a legal obligation not to publish false or misleading information about objectively verifiable facts. 
5. Receiving the requested records will aid the public in either substantiating or falsifying the agency's claim about death in custody "average" being "the lowest in ICE history.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: ICE FOIA 2026-ICFO-08352
communications.communication:
12/31/2025 

Andrew  Free 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR199747 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2026-ICFO-08352 
 
Dear Requester: 

This acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), dated 12/11/2025, and to your request for expedited treatment. Your request was received in this office on 12/11/2025. Specifically, you requested records pertaining to Shiraz Fatehali Sachwani. 

Your request for expedited treatment is hereby denied. 

Under the DHS FOIA regulations, expedited processing of a FOIA request is warranted if the request involves “circumstances in which the lack of expedited treatment could reasonably be expected to pose an imminent threat to the life or physical safety of an individual,” 6 C.F.R. § 5.5(e)(1)(i), or “an urgency to inform the public about an actual or alleged federal government activity, if made by a person primarily engaged in disseminating information,” 6 C.F.R. § 5.5(e)(l)(ii).  Requesters seeking expedited processing must submit a statement explaining in detail the basis for the request, and that statement must be certified by the requester to be true and correct.  6 C.F.R. § 5.5(e)(3). 

Your request for expedited processing is denied because you do not qualify for either category under 6 C.F.R. § 5.5(e)(1).   You have not established that lack of expedited treatment in this case will pose an imminent threat to the life or physical safety of an individual.  While you may be primarily engaged in the dissemination of information, you have not detailed with specificity why you feel there is an urgency to inform the public about Shiraz Fatehali Sachwani.  Qualifying urgency would need to exceed the public’s right to know about government activity generally.  You also did not offer sufficient supporting evidence of an interest of the public greater than the public’s general interest in Shiraz Fatehali Sachwani.  Your letter was conclusory in nature and did not present any facts to justify a grant of expedited processing under the applicable standards. 

Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request. Per Section 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5, ICE processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt. Although ICE’s goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, the FOIA does permit a 10- day extension of this time period. As your request seeks numerous documents that will necessitate a thorough and wide-ranging search, ICE will invoke a 10-day extension for your request, as allowed by Title 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B). If you care to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office. We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner. 

Provisions of the FOIA allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request.  We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS Interim FOIA regulations, as they apply to media requesters.  As a media requester, you will be charged 10 cents per page for duplication; the first 100 pages are free.  We will construe the submission of your request as an agreement to pay up to $25.00. You will be contacted before any further fees are accrued. 

If you deem the decision to deny expedited treatment of your request an adverse determination, you have the right to appeal.  Should you wish to do so, you must send your appeal and a copy of this letter, within 90 days of the date of this letter following the procedures outlined in the DHS FOIA regulations at 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(e)(2). You may submit your appeal electronically at GILDFOIAAppeals@ice.dhs.gov or via regular mail to: 

U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Office of the Principal Legal Advisor 
U.S. Department of Homeland Security 
500 12th Street,, S.W., Mail Stop 5900 
Washington, D.C. 20536-5900 

Your envelope and letter should be marked “FOIA Appeal.”  Copies of the FOIA and DHS regulations are available at www.dhs.gov/foia. 

ICE has queried the appropriate program offices within ICE for responsive records. If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability. Please be assured that one of the processors in our office will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request. 

If you have any questions, please contact the FOIA office or Daniel Edgington, FOIA Public Liaison at 500 12th St. SW Stop 5009 Washington, DC 20536-5009 or (866) 633-1182. Additionally, you have a right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974.  You may contact OGIS as follows:  Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448. 

Your request has been assigned tracking number 2026-ICFO-08352. Please use this number in future correspondence. 

Sincerely, 

ICE FOIA Office 
Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Freedom of Information Act Office 
500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009 
Washington, D.C. 20536-5009

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2026-ICFO-08352
communications.communication: I hereby appeal the denial of expedited processing. I sought expedited processing based on ICE's unprecedented and demonstrably false statement about the "lowest" rate of in-custody deaths in history. You chose to interpret the basis for expedited processing as an urgency to inform the public about the passing of a single individual. By ignoring the thrust of the need to inform the public, your office erred in denying expedited treatment.

communications.subject: ICE FOIA 2026-ICAP-00128, 2026-ICFO-08352
communications.communication:
01/21/2026 

Andrew  Free 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR199747 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2026-ICAP-00128, 2026-ICFO-08532 

Dear Requester: 

The Department of Homeland Security has received your letter appealing the adverse determination of your Freedom of Information Act/Privacy Act (FOIA/PA) request by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement. Your appeal, dated on 1/1/2026, was received on 1/17/2026. 

The Government Information Law Division acknowledges your appeal request of and is assigning it number 2026-ICAP-00128 for tracking purposes.  Please reference this number in any future communications about your appeal. 

A high number of FOIA/PA requests have been received by the Department.  Accordingly, we have adopted the court-sanctioned practice of generally handling backlogged appeals on a first-in, first-out basis.   While we will make every effort to process your appeal on a timely basis, there may be some delay in resolving this matter.  Should you have any questions concerning the processing of your appeal, please contact Daniel Edgington ICE FOIA Office/Public Liaison at (866) 633-1182 or at 500 12th St., SW Washington, DC 20536-5009. 

Sincerely, 
 
Sara Jazayeri 
Chief 
Government Information Law Division 
ICE Office of the Principal Legal Advisor 
U.S. Department of Homeland Security

title: Department of Defense support for 2024 documentary "Bring Them Home"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Defense support for 2024 documentary "Bring Them Home"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the production of the 2024 documentary "Bring Them Home," directed by Daniel Glick et al. Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; photographs; and all records of communications between employees of DoD and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Bring Them Home," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

"Bring Them Home" appears on a list of DoD entertainment industry collaborations released to me through FOIA. The list is attached to this request.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Meiner emails: Facebook comment

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Meiner emails: Facebook comment
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any electronic communications received by Mayor Steven Meiner between 7 January 2025 and 20 January 2025 regarding Raquel Pacheco's Facebook comments and the police questioning of Pacheco over those comments. If the emails include any attachments, please include those attachments as well.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

 The following is the email cost estimate for your request, Request Number: PRR-2026-218: 
  
 The cost estimate associated with your request includes a special service charge based on the labor cost of the employee providing the service of compiling the records and reviewing the records for any information that is confidential or exempt. Please note that the special service charge is for time spent in excess of thirty minutes. The cost estimate for the records in response to your request is as follows: 
  
 Email search resulted in 21 emails. 
  
 We charge the hourly rate of the lowest person in the department capable of handling the email review: 
  
 It took the I.T. Technician 30 minutes at a rate of $55.00 an hour = $0.00 
  
 We charge the hourly rate for every 100 pages reviewed at a rate of $40.00 for a total number of pages, 46 = $40.00 
  
 A 50% percent deposit is required prior to reviewing the records in the amount of $20.00. Upon receipt of payment, we will process the request.

title: Lake Geneva Wisconsin land sale appraisal

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Lake Geneva Wisconsin land sale appraisal
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Appraisal for tax key parcels ZA467900001, ZA467900002, ZA468000001 & ZA468000002.
In the city of Lake Geneva, Wisconsin. Used by the Lake Geneva Wisconsin City Council on 1/12/26.
Also invoice for said appraisal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Gary Milliette

Hello,

The City is in receipt of your open records request. Please be aware of the following if applicable:
•	The charge for copies of records is 25 cents per side of page.
•	The charge for any other media is at the actual cost.
•	Pursuant to 19.35(3)(f), Wis. Stats., if the amount to be imposed is more than $5.00, the authority may require prepayment. 
•	Pursuant to Section 19.35(3)(c), Wis. Stats., if the cost to locate the record will cost more than $50.00, the authority may require payment of the location costs. 
•	If a record request response is mailed, the authority may charge the actual postage amount, to be paid before mailing.
•	The City is not obligated to provide records in the format requested. Grebner v. Schiebel, 2001 WI App 17, 240 Wis.2d 551.
•	The City is not obligated to provide records in a time frame established by the requester. Reasonableness of the response time is determined by the volume of records requested, the ability to locate the records, review of records for possible redaction, and other work assignments. Journal Times v. City of Racine Bd. of Police & Fire Comm’rs, 2015 WI 56, 362 Wis.2d 577; WIREdata Inc. v. Village of Sussex, 2008 WI 69, 310 Wis.2d 397.
We are in the process of evaluating your request and will provide further information as it becomes available. 

Thank you,

Vanessa Jahns
 
Deputy City Clerk

Hello,

The response letter and requested documents are attached.
Please let me know if the attachments give you trouble, or if you have any questions.

Thank you,

Vanessa Jahns
Deputy City Clerk

title: 2026 Brady List (Prosecuting Attorney)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: 2026 Brady List (Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office, along with accompanying potential impeachment material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Sheriff Public Records Request :: S026818-010526
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Spokane County. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. Your request was received in this office on 1/5/2026 and given the reference number S026818-010526 for tracking purposes. Spokane County Sheriff provides access to public records in compliance with applicable laws and statutes of the State of Washington. In accordance with the public records law, the Sheriff's office has five business days to respond to a request for public records. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office, along with accompanying potential impeachment material. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2169967/ 
Not all public documents are available in electronic format. If the document(s) requested are not available electronically, we will make them available for inspection or by paper copy in accordance with the Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW, does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
 
Please be advised that Spokane Regional Emergency Communications ("SREC") is the custodian of 911 and Crime Check audio recordings as well as audio recordings of dispatch and radio traffic. If you are attempting to obtain audio recordings of 911/Crime Check calls and/or radio traffic, you need to submit a separate request to SREC directly. You can submit a records request to SREC via their website, https://www.srec911.com. 
Spokane County

communications.subject: [Records Center] Sheriff Public Records Request :: S026818-010526
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Rose Terse: 
In accordance with the Public Records Act, RCW 42.56.520, this message acknowledges receipt of your public records request, received by Spokane County on 1/5/2026. This request has been assigned reference code records S026818-010526. Please include this code in any communications concerning this request. 
Specifically, you requested: “To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office, along with accompanying potential impeachment material. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2169967/” Our procedure is to locate records, review them for exemptions, and then prepare them for your inspection or copying. Due to the potential volume of records that may be responsive to this request, as well as the complexity of identifying and gathering the records, we anticipate processing this request in installments. We are currently processing over 1300 active requests. This does mean that it can take time to process requests, but we work to provide requestors with installments of their records on a timely basis. 
The first installment of responsive records are now available for download in the “My Request Center” of the public records portal. Instructions for downloading the files follows:  
  * Navigate to the Spokane County Public Records Center by following the blue "Public Records Center" hyperlink contained in the footer of this email. 
  * Log in with your user name and password. You will be taken directly into this request. 
  * Click on the "Download All" button directly above the blue "Files" box. *If you have a pop-up blocker, you will need to allow pop-ups for this site in order for the files to download. After they have downloaded, if the files do not open automatically, they will appear in your computer's "Downloads" folder. The attached is an unofficial list. While we have the IA investigation information and letter from the Prosecutor's office, the Sheriff's office does not make the determination of who or why someone goes on the list. The official list/documentation is kept by the Prosecutor's Office. Please claim your installment by reviewing or downloading the available records. If this installment has not been claimed within 30 days, or by 2/6/2026, this request will be considered abandoned and will be administratively closed as of that date. Once the available installment has been claimed, we will provide you with the estimated date of the next installment. To schedule an appointment to view the records in person at no charge, please call us at 509-477-6926. 
The Spokane County Sheriff's Office is obligated to provide records in accordance with the Washington State Public Records Act. Please note that the records you have requested may contain images and/or descriptions of events that are considered graphic in nature and may not be suitable for children or those who are sensitive to such material. 
With respect to audio recordings, please be advised that Spokane Regional Emergency Communications ("SREC") is the custodian of 911/Crime Check audio recordings as well as audio recordings of radio traffic. If you are attempting to obtain audio recordings of 911/Crime Check calls and/or radio traffic, you need to submit a separate request to SREC directly via the following link: https://srec911.com/  PLEASE NOTE: If you want to pick up printed copies of the records from the Public Safety Building, you must call at least one business day before you plan to arrive so that we can have the records ready for you. Depending on the number of pages, printing charges may apply. 509-477-6926 
Sincerely, 
JOHN F. NOWELS, Sheriff 
Spokane County 
DB 
Public Records Specialist 
Please do not update subject line above when replying.

--- Please respond above this line --- 

Rose Terse: 

Thank you for your public records request. This message acknowledges receipt of your request, which was received on January 13, 2026. This request has been assigned reference No. R013345-011326. We ask that you please refer to that number in any future correspondence regarding this request. 

Specifically, you requested the following: 
“To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office, along with accompanying potential impeachment material. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse” 

Our procedure is to locate records, review them for exemptions, and then prepare them for your inspection or copying. Your request was forwarded to the following Spokane County departments for review and compiling of responsive records: Prosecuting Attorney. The attached is the current PID list as you requested. 

We have not redacted or withheld any records in this installment. Because the production of documents for this installment is below the threshold for which we assess a fee for the reproduction or delivery of records, we provide this installment to you free of charge. 
After reviewing your request, we determined that clarification is necessary before we can move forward. It is unclear from your request what specific records you are attempting to obtain. Pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, we require clarification of your statement " along with accompanying impeachment material". Please clarify what specific records you are trying to obtain so that we may be able to locate responsive documents, if any. 

Until we receive clarification, we cannot act further upon your request. 
If we do not receive your clarification on or before February 16, 2026, we will consider this request to be abandoned. This means your request will be considered completed and closed because we cannot identify any responsive records. The Public Records Act provides for a one-year statute of limitations under RCW 42.56.550(6). This is the time allowed by law for you to seek judicial review. In our view, this period will begin to run on February 17, 2026 unless sufficient clarification is received. 

We look forward to receiving clarification on your public records request. 
Finally, please be advised that there may be fees associated with the reproduction or delivery of public records. Please take a moment to familiarize yourself with our Fee Schedule which is available in the FAQs. If your request requires payment, you will be sent an invoice before the records are released. . 
Sincerely, 

A Deveney 
Public Records Specialist 
509-477-5764 
Please do not update subject line above when replying.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #R013345-011326
communications.communication:
Hello,

In your previous communication, you asked me to clarify the phrase in my request "along with accompanying impeachment material." Prosecutors offices typically retain discovery materials which are disclosed when an officer on the Brady List is involved in litigation. These are the materials I am referring to in my original request.

Thank you,
Rose

communications.subject: [Records Center] Public Records Request :: R013345-011326
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Rose Terse: 
I’m writing to update you on your public records request assigned reference code R013345-011326. I received the message you sent with the clarification requested.  Thank you for providing that information. 
Our procedure is to locate records, review them for exemptions, and then prepare them for your inspection or copying. Due to the potential volume of records that may be responsive to this request, as well as the complexity of identifying and gathering the records, I anticipate processing this request in installments. I am currently processing over 35 active requests. This does mean that it can take time to process requests, but we work to provide requestors with installments of their records on a timely basis. 
We reasonably anticipate an installment/requested records will be available on or before February 17, 2026. If public records become available in advance of this estimate, we will let you know. Conversely, if staff encounters a need to extend our estimate, we will advise accordingly. 
Sincerely, 
A Deveney 
Public Records Specialist 
509-477-5764 
Andrea Deveney 
Public Records Specialist 
Please do not update subject line above when replying.

Rose Terse: 

I’m writing to update you on your public records request assigned reference code R013345-011326. 
An installment of responsive records is now available. Please find the responsive records attached to this email. Installment 1 is the Potential Impeachment Disclosure list as well as the first set of records that have been reviewed for release. 

Please note that there are redactions (black boxes) on various pages of the responsive documents. Redactions may be small or large, depending on the size of the redaction. There may be multiple redactions on a page. Within a redaction is a white code, which will look something like [1a]. The code printed within the redaction designates the exemption on the attached Spokane County Exemption Log. The log identifies the statutes for the corresponding redaction codes and explains why they apply to the specific portion of the record being withheld. 
Because the production of documents for this installment is below the threshold for which we assess a fee for the reproduction or delivery of records, we provide this installment to you free of charge. 

Staff will require additional time to complete the search, review all compiled records for exempt information, and redact records if necessary. We estimate the next installment will be available on or before April 13, 2026. If an installment is available before that, we will try to produce it when it becomes available. Sincerely,

Public Records Specialist

communications.subject: [Records Center] Sheriff Public Records Request :: S026818-010526
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Rose Terse: 
This message is to provide an update regarding your public records request assigned reference code S026818-010526. Please include this code in any communications concerning this request. 
Specifically, you requested: “To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office, along with accompanying potential impeachment material. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2169967/” 
The responsive records are now available for download in the “My Request Center” of the public records portal. Instructions for downloading the files follows:  
  * Navigate to the Spokane County Public Records Center by following the blue "Public Records Center" hyperlink contained in the footer of this email. 
  * Log in with your user name and password. You will be taken directly into this request. 
  * Click on the "Download All" button directly above the blue "Files" box. *If you have a pop-up blocker, you will need to allow pop-ups for this site in order for the files to download. After they have downloaded, if the files do not open automatically, they will appear in your computer's "Downloads" folder. 
The Spokane County Sheriff's Office is obligated to provide records in accordance with the Washington State Public Records Act. Please note that the records you have requested may contain images and/or descriptions of events that are considered graphic in nature and may not be suitable for children or those who are sensitive to such material. 
This request is now considered concluded and closed because all responsive records have been provided. This is our final, definitive response to this request. Now that this request is closed, the Public Records Act's one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review has started to run because the agency does not intend to further address this request. If you have questions or concerns about this request, please contact us within 10 business days of the date of this message. If we may be of further assistance, please advise. PLEASE NOTE: If you want to pick up printed copies of the records from the Public Safety Building, you must call 509-477-6926 at least one business day before you plan to arrive so that we can have the records ready for you. Depending on the number of pages, printing charges may apply. 
Sincerely, 
JOHN F. NOWELS, Sheriff 
Spokane County 
DB 
Public Records Specialist 
Please do not update subject line above when replying.

title: Documents on Mobile Identify (Hillsboro Police Department)

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Documents on Mobile Identify (Hillsboro Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

### Background ###

Mobile Identify is an app that uses facial recognition to identify people and bring up their immigration status. You can read more here: https://www.404media.co/cbp-quietly-launches-face-scanning-app-for-local-cops-to-do-immigration-enforcement/

### Request ###

- All policies, memoranda of understanding, data-sharing agreements, or terms of use applying to "Mobile Identify", from 1st January 2025 to the present.
- All user manuals and technical documentation for "Mobile Identify", from 1st January 2025 to the present.
- All written communications and emails (including attachments), from 1st October 2025 to the present, containing any of the following terms: "Mobile Identify"

In order to help to determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am an individual citizen of Oregon.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Chris Martin

communications.subject: FW: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Documents on Mobile Identify (Hillsboro Police Department)
communications.communication:
Hello,

Your request was forwarded to me for review and processing.  The Hillsboro Police Department does not use “Mobile Identify” and, as such, has no records responsive to your first two requests.  If you would still like to pursue your request for the third item, “All written communications and emails (including attachments), from 1st October 2025 to the present, containing any of the following terms: ‘Mobile Identify’”, please let me know and we will send you a fee estimate for an email search.

Thank you,

Leah Turner | she/her | Police Executive Manager
City of Hillsboro, Oregon | Police Department: Analytic Services
503-615-6718 (desk) | 503-681-6267 (fax)
Hillsboro-Oregon.gov<http://www.hillsboro-oregon.gov/> | Engage with Us<http://engage.hillsboro-oregon.gov/> | Hillsboro-Oregon.gov/Police<https://www.hillsboro-oregon.gov/our-city/departments/police>


________________________________

However, it is worth noting that all of the results fell into one of two categories:  1- The emails between you and HPD related to your Public Records Request or 2- Emails/tickets from me to IT requesting a search for emails related to your request.

The fee estimate to produce the records is $40.  (Estimate based on an additional 30 minutes to produce the records at the "Analyst Personnel Review" rate listed on the City of Hillsboro fee schedule (attached).

If you would like to request copies of the eight (8) emails, please remit payment of $40 to Hillsboro Police Department, 250 SE 10th Ave, Hillsboro, OR 97123, attn Leah Turner.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Thank you,

Leah Turner | she/her | Police Executive Manager

title: Department of Defense support for 2024 film "Something to Stand for with Mike Rowe"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Defense support for 2024 film "Something to Stand for with Mike Rowe"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the production of the 2024 movie "Something to Stand for with Mike Rowe." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of DoD and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Something to Stand for with Mike Rowe," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

"Something to Stand for with Mike Rowe" appears on a list of DoD entertainment industry collaborations released to me through FOIA. The list is attached to this request.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo
